# print rpc log
You can enable the RPC logging feature to print the full RPC requests sent by Hardhat, the responses received, as well as the transaction body before signing. Here's the log format:
```js
jsonRpcRequest: {
  jsonrpc: '2.0',
  method: 'eth_getTransactionCount',
  params: [ '0xf39fd6e51aad88f6f4ce6ab8827279cfffb92266', 'pending' ],
  id: 5
}
jsonRpcResponse: { jsonrpc: '2.0', result: '0x9b', id: 5 }
eth_sendRawTransaction: {
  gas: '385924',
  from: '0xf39fd6e51aad88f6f4ce6ab8827279cfffb92266',
  data: '',
  maxFeePerGas: '1692',
  maxPriorityFeePerGas: '0',
  nonce: '155'
}
jsonRpcRequest: {
  jsonrpc: '2.0',
  method: 'eth_sendRawTransaction',
  params: [
    ''
  ],
  id: 7
}
jsonRpcResponse: {
  jsonrpc: '2.0',
  result: '0x0dfdf464554ce1adfc0454521124192ce633cd31e340b5442dbfcabccae7e4dd',
  id: 7
}
```
## Enable and Disable rpc log printing
enable  
`npm run addRpcLog`

disable  
`rm -rf node_modules/hardhat && npm install hardhat && chmod +x node_modules/.bin/hardhat`
